response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age", "high", "At 19, being a young male is associated with a higher risk of recidivism due to developmental factors and social influences."],
    ["Criminal history", "medium", "Having one arrest, even without conviction, suggests some exposure to criminal behavior which moderately increases risk."],
    ["Substance use", "medium", "Marijuana use in the past four years indicates a moderate risk factor due to its association with broader behavioral issues."],
    ["Mental health", "high", "Experiencing prolonged depressive symptoms is a significant risk factor that can contribute to higher recidivism likelihood."],
    ["Employment", "high", "Lack of job holding over the past year is a high risk factor as it is linked to economic instability and reduced social integration."],
    ["Education", "medium", "Holding only a GED and no college enrollment is moderately associated with recidivism due to potential limitations in opportunities."],
    ["Marital status", "low", "Being married and living with a spouse is generally protective and reduces risk."],
    ["Family background", "low", "Growing up with both biological parents in a stable household is a protective factor."],
    ["Religious belief", "low", "Belief that God plays a role in personal outcomes is a protective factor due to potential reliance on social and moral values."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 75
}

risk_factors: At 19, being a young male is associated with a higher risk of recidivism due to developmental factors and social influences.
Having one arrest, even without conviction, suggests some exposure to criminal behavior which moderately increases risk.
Marijuana use in the past four years indicates a moderate risk factor due to its association with broader behavioral issues.
Experiencing prolonged depressive symptoms is a significant risk factor that can contribute to higher recidivism likelihood.
Lack of job holding over the past year is a high risk factor as it is linked to economic instability and reduced social integration.
Holding only a GED and no college enrollment is moderately associated with recidivism due to potential limitations in opportunities.
Being married and living with a spouse is generally protective and reduces risk.
Growing up with both biological parents in a stable household is a protective factor.
Belief that God plays a role in personal outcomes is a protective factor due to potential reliance on social and moral values.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 19-year-old male who identifies himself as Black. He has been arrested 1 time but has not been convicted. He is 5 feet 8 inches and weighs 165 lbs. He is married and is currently living with his spouse. He has a GED certificate and is not enrolled in college. He has held no jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana) and most of the time during the past month he has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer him up. At a young age, he lived with both of his biological parents in a household of size 5, in a rural area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
